Data: Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run shortish and outside off, Williamson drags it across to the man at deep square leg with a pull. That single also brings up the fifty partnership

Faulkner to Guptill, no run off-pace delivery again and Guptill doesn't read it. Lovely deception. Pitches it on a good length and manages to get a little more bounce than the batsman expects, to hit him on the thigh
Faulkner to Guptill, 1 run fuller delivery outside off, drives it past mid-on's left
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run moves across onto off stump to glance a shortish delivery on middle to long leg
Faulkner to Guptill, no run good length ball on off stump, defends to mdiwicket
Cummins to Williamson, 1 run glides a back of a length delivery to deep third man. Uses all the 142 kph pace to his own benefit
Cummins to Guptill, no run opens the face at the last second to try and beat the man at point, but this 146 kph delivery doesn't let him do so

Cummins to Guptill, FOUR runs lifts it over the wicketkeeper! This is purely intentional. This is absolutely brilliant. In the idea at least, if not the execution. Guptill knows Cummins is giving him so much pace than he knows what to do with, and so the moment it is pitched short, even if it is on middle, he swerves his torso back and ramps it
Cummins to Guptill, no run bangs it into middle of the deck and gives the batsman an easy sighter. Bouncer avoided
Cummins to Guptill, 1 run 121 kph, that's the slower ball, full on off stump, Guptill picks it, blocks it into the cover point region for a single
Cummins to Williamson, no run back of a length and just outside off, defends
Faulkner to Guptill, 1 leg bye angles it into the pads and Guptill is unable to do what he wants to, tickle it past the left of short fine leg, which would have been a boundary
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run good length ball outside off, Williamson directs it off the open face to deep third man

Faulkner to Guptill, no run oh, misses out again. And this is a poorer ball than earlier in the over because the line is way down leg. Guptill manages to get bat, but the flick shot picks out short fine leg - the only man there

Faulkner to Guptill, FOUR runs full and wide outside off, and Guptill is able to pick the gap between point and short third man. He was originally intending to glide it, but seeing as the delivery didn't have much pace but gave him all the room he needed to free his arms, he hit it a lot harder
Faulkner to Guptill, 1 run defends towards point, with soft hands, and sneaks a single
Faulkner to Williamson, 1 run gets on top of the bounce of this shortish delivery on off stump and whips it through midwicket
Stoinis to Williamson, no run pretty full and outside off, Williamson leans back, plays very, very late and ends up chopping the ball behind to the keeper
Stoinis to Williamson, 1 run good length and angled in at off stump, uses his wrists and manoeuvres the ball to square leg
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run back of a length and on off stump, Guptill hangs back and chops a cheeky single to the right of Handscomb behind the stumps
Stoinis to Williamson, 1 run just short of a good length and outside off, leans back, gently punches in front of point and sets off to the other end
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run rising short ball outside off, Guptill rises with it and blunts the ball to cover

Stoinis to Williamson, OUT bat-pad catch to backward point running to his left. Big appeal from Stoinis and the keeper. Umpire Knights' finger goes up. Stoinis snaffles Williamson in his first over. Back of a length and angled in at off stump, kicks up, Williamson jumps off the ground and seeks to work the ball to the leg side. The ball grazes the inside edge, then the thigh pad, and pops up to Maxwell. Williamson is Stonis' maiden one-day international victim. How ab
Starc to Guptill, no run full and outside off, pushed down to mid-off
Starc to Guptill, no run wide yorker, squeezed out
Starc to Guptill, no run full and angling away outside off, presses forward and drives back to Starc
Starc to Guptill, no run length ball, shaped to come in, then seams away past the skittish waft
Starc to Guptill, 1 run back of a length and slanting away outside off, Guptill helps it down to third man for one
Starc to Taylor, no run pitched up and slanting away outside off, left alone
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run back of a length and outside off, Guptill runs it down to third man. He raises his bat and acknowledges his half-century, taking in the applause from the home crowd.

Stoinis to Taylor, 5 wide Stoinis runs in hard, hits the deck hard, this one absolutely flies off the surface, and beats a leaping Handscomb. Tough day behind the stumps. Taylor avoided it. Five wides it is
Stoinis to Taylor, 1 run length and outside off, Taylor simply taps it down to third man
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run tip-and-run single to the left of the keeper
Stoinis to Taylor, 2 runs excellent placement and running to boot from Taylor. Fullish and on off, Taylor, with a more pronounced side-on stance, simply dabs it in the gap at square leg
Stoinis to Taylor, no run nice and full outside off, Taylor flows forward and drives through the line. Hits crisply but can't beat mid-off now
Stoinis to Taylor, no run back of a length and outside off, jabbed to point and that's drinks
Starc to Guptill, no run back of a length, bounces at Guptill, 140ks, catches him in an awkward tangle
Starc to Guptill, no run short on leg stump, 139.6ks, tucks 'em up for room. Guptill fends it back to Starc
Starc to Guptill, 1 run just short of a good length and speared wide outside off, Guptill flat-bats a cut to sweeper
Starc to Taylor, no run very full and wide outside off, Taylor watches it through to the keeper
Starc to Taylor, no run very full and on a set of stumps outside off, Taylor does not bother going after it
Starc to Taylor, FOUR runs Taylor brings up New Zealand's hundred with a sliced drive. Full and much closer to off, opens the face and carves it away between the covers and point
Stoinis to Guptill, no run just short of a good length and angled in on off, the batsman hangs back and plays it back to the bowler
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run length and outside off, tip-and-run single to point
Stoinis to Taylor, no run full and outside off, presses forward, meets the pitch and drives the ball to short cover
Stoinis to Taylor, 1 run short and outside off, Taylor does not need any second invitations for the cut. Chopped down to third man
Stoinis to Guptill, 2 runs short of a length and outside off, Guptill gets up on his tippy toes and plays a jabbing punch square through the off side
Stoinis to Guptill, no run back of a length and sort of skids through outside off, Guptill is stapled to the crease as he swishes and only connects with thin air
Head to Taylor, 1 run full and slow on off stump, Taylor shuffles across off, goes low, and paddles to long leg
Head to Guptill, 1 wide quick fizzer down leg, left alone
Head to Guptill, no run straight ball on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket

Head to Guptill, 4 byes Handscomb's day gets tougher. He is nutmegged. Guptill pre-meditates shuffling outside leg stump for a scoop to the left of the keeper. Guptill is beaten, as is the keeper, as the ball goes through his legs
Head to Guptill, 1 run pretty full and slid across off stump, Guptill edges it, the ball grazes the pad of Handscomb and streaks away down towards third man
Head to Taylor, no run veering into the pads, tucked around the corner
Head to Taylor, 1 wide leg-side wide
Head to Taylor, 1 run paddled down towards long leg

Stoinis to Taylor, no run short and wide outside off, thumps a cut to the left of Maxwell. He spins around, aims at the striker's end, and misses. Taylor was off for a single, a direct hit could have dismissed Taylor
Stoinis to Taylor, 1 run back of a length and outside off, Taylor rides it down to third man for one
Stoinis to Guptill, no run just short of a good length on middle, fended back to the bowler
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run short and skidding into the hips, fended square on the leg side

Stoinis to Taylor, 1 run Taylor takes Maxwell's arm on for the third time in six balls. Tips it to point and scampers across. Maxwell still can't connect with a direct hit. This time he misses at the striker's end
Head to Taylor, no run flatter on the pads, knocked to short fine leg
Head to Taylor, no run skidding into the pads, pitched outside leg, Taylor does not make contact with a paddle sweep and weathers the leg-before appeal
Head to Taylor, 1 run this time Taylor succeeds in paddling a single down to long leg
Head to Guptill, 2 runs Guptill skips out, Head drags his length back, this one angles across the batsman, takes the edge and rolls down fine of short third man
Head to Guptill, no run full on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
Head to Guptill, no run pitched up on off, driven to mid-off, who is inside the circle
Stoinis to Taylor, 1 run chest-high short ball outside off, Taylor is ready for it on the back foot, rolling his wrists and pulling to deep square leg
Stoinis to Guptill, no run length ball, wicket-to-wicket stuff, played back to Stoinis
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run length ball on off, drives on the up, hits through the line to mid-off
Stoinis to Taylor, 1 wide high short ball outside off, boings off the surface, Taylor can't hook it away
Stoinis to Taylor, no run full and outside off, whipped away on the front foot to straight midwicket
Stoinis to Taylor, 1 run pitched up and outside off, driven to the right of mid-off for one now. Taylor chances another single. Finch can't throw the stumps down
Stoinis to Guptill, no run back of a length and outside off, firmly struck more or less straight to mid-off
Head to Taylor, 1 run fired on leg or just outside leg, swept to long leg
Head to Guptill, 1 run full on middle, not much turn, push-driven to long-on

Head to Taylor, OUT too full for the sweep and Taylor drags it back onto the stumps. Tossed up and angling across off, wide outside off, Taylor goes low and makes a mess of the sweep. Head reaps reward for some tight bowling
Head to Broom, 1 run looped up on middle and leg, Broom - returning from a finger injury, works through midwicket
Head to Guptill, no run flatter and quicker, swept away to square leg
Head to Guptill, no run pushed through quicker, Guptill defends
Stoinis to Broom, 1 leg bye waddles across off and deflects a ball ball square on the leg side
Stoinis to Guptill, no run ull and angled in on off, spooned in front of midwicket
Stoinis to Guptill, no run full and angled in on off, punched to cover on the front foot

Stoinis to Guptill, OUT bowled'em. Stoinis has nabbed both Williamson and Guptill. Sneaks through the gate. Half-volley length, bowled from wide of the crease, right up there to be laced through the covers. Guptill attempts a drive, but the ball cuts back in slightly and goes through the defences. Hits middle and leg stumps with the offcutter
Stoinis to Munro, 1 run full on the pads, whipped away through deep square leg
Stoinis to Broom, 1 run glanced off the hips to square leg
Head to Broom, no run wicket-to-wicket line, bunted to straight midwicket
Head to Broom, 1 run flighted and angled across off, gets forward, meets the pitch, and eases it through cover
Head to Munro, no run fired outside off, driven to the straighter of the two catching covers
Head to Munro, no run full and on off, dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. Pushed to mid-on off the inside half
Head to Munro, no run Handscomb drops another catch. Shorter offbreak from Head, spins away from the left-hander. He goes back for a cut, outside-edges it behind, the ball clangs off the gloves
Head to Munro, 1 run tossed on middle, driven on the front foot to long-on

Stoinis to Munro, OUT length and outside off, Munro shovels it in the air off the inside half and hands a loopy catch to Finch. Not a full-blooded hit from the left-hander. He aimed to clear mid-on, instead chipped it to Australia's captain. So Handscomb's drop costs Australia just one run
Stoinis to Neesham, no run left alone outside off
Stoinis to Neesham, 1 run leg-side delivery, glided down to long leg
Stoinis to Broom, no run offcutter, comes in, beats the inside edge and clatters into the back thigh
Stoinis to Broom, 1 run full and angled in on off, tucked around the corner through square leg
Stoinis to Neesham, 2 runs full on middle and leg, worked through backward square leg for a double
Head to Broom, 1 run wicket-to-wicket line from around the stumps, flipped through square leg
Head to Neesham, FOUR runs looped up outside off, Neesham presses forward and hoists it over the short straight boundary. First boundary after 10 overs
Head to Neesham, 1 run picked off the pads to the leg side for one
Head to Broom, 1 run sliding into the leg stump, directed to long leg for one
Head to Neesham, no run short and skids on, defended on the back foot
Head to Neesham, 1 run shorter and outside off, skips back and cuts through cover-point for one
Stoinis to Neesham, no run full and skidding across off, Neesham has a loose waft and watches the ball whistle past the outside edge
Stoinis to Neesham, 1 run short and outside off, hangs back and chops down to third man
Stoinis to Broom, 1 run worked off the pads to square leg
Stoinis to Neesham, 1 run
Stoinis to Broom, 1 run overpitched and outside off, front-foot drive. Placed to the left of extra cover and to the right of mid-off. The latter makes a tumbling save
Stoinis to Neesham, 1 run
Cummins to Neesham, no run tucked off the hips to long leg
Cummins to Neesham, 1 run short of a length and outside off, dabbed down to wide slip
Cummins to Broom, 1 run back of a length on off, hops and nurdles a single in front of midwicket

Cummins to Neesham, FOUR runs 142.5ks short ball outside off, Neesham is beaten for pace. He is rushed into a hook and ends up top-edging the ball over the keeper's head. Evades long leg sliding to his right. One-bounce four
Cummins to Neesham, no run bouncer, ducks under it

Cummins to Neesham, FOUR runs short of a length and slanting away outside off, Neesham has a waft away from the body. The ball grazes the inside edge and rolls away past the stumps fine on the leg side. French-cut away
Stoinis to Broom, no run full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket on the front foot
Stoinis to Broom, no run full offcutter, opens the face and runs the ball to point
Stoinis to Broom, 1 run short of a length and outside off, arches his back and upper-cuts to third man
Stoinis to Neesham, FOUR runs biffed down the ground to the right of mid-on. Back of a length and outside off, stood up tall and punched away past the bowler's left
Stoinis to Neesham, no run short of a length and outside off, chopped away to the right of Maxwell at backward point
Stoinis to Neesham, 1 run leg-stump delivery, which is easily glanced to long leg

Cummins to Neesham, 1 run Marsh drops it at wide slip diving across to his right. Went with one hand, the ball popped out of it. Full and angling across off, Neesham wafts with his feet stapled to the crease and gets away. Marsh was late onto it
Cummins to Broom, no run
Cummins to Broom, 1 run full and outside off, steered into the covers for one
Cummins to Neesham, 1 run pretty full on the pads, glanced to long leg
Cummins to Broom, 1 run short of a length and outside off, jumps back and secures a single to deep third man with a late cut
Cummins to Neesham, no run half-volley outside off, drilled on the front foot straight to mid-off
Stoinis to Broom, 1 run back of a length on off, hangs back and works it past midwicket's right for one
Stoinis to Neesham, 1 run short of a length on the hips, tucked around the corner, through square leg
Stoinis to Broom, 2 runs full on off, clipped to the right of square leg for a couple
Stoinis to Broom, 1 run short of a length on off, chopped behind square on the off side for one. To the left of Maxwell at backward point
Stoinis to Neesham, no run full and sliding into the pads, Neesham misses out on a scoring opportunity. That should have been put away through midwicket

Stoinis to Neesham, 2 runs back of a length on middle and leg, hangs back and whips through midwicket for two. Excellent running. End of an uninterrupted spell from Stoinis: 10-0-49-3. And that's drinks at Eden Park

Faulkner to Broom, FOUR runs well, that bodes well for New Zealand, moving into the final stage of the innings. Broom waits on a shortish delivery outside off, letting it come on and then chops down on it. Late cut past deep third man's right

Faulkner to Broom, 1 run squares him up with the angle from over the wicket as a back of a length ball pitches on leg stump and decks away off the seam. Broom, intending to work the ball to midwicket, gets a leading edge past point
Faulkner to Neesham, no run into the pads and Neesham, trying to glance it fine, doesn't get any bat on it. Could have easily been a boundary with fine leg up

Faulkner to Neesham, no run strikes him in the box, or close to, I think. A little bit of seam movement into the left-hander, who is surprised by the movement, the ball beating his inside edge and pinning him
Faulkner to Neesham, no run shortish and outside off, Neesham looks for a cut, but plays the shot under the ball. No footwork
Faulkner to Neesham, 1 run length ball outside off, flat-batted through the covers. That's the back of the hand slower ball, bringing up the fifty-partnership. And they've got there in 49 balls
Hazlewood to Neesham, no run cramps him up with a 132 kph delivery on off stump, Neesham goes for the pull, but is perhaps into the shot just a touch late. Inside edge onto his thigh
Hazlewood to Neesham, 1 run nudges the back of a length ball to the left of midwicket
Hazlewood to Broom, no run tries to work a good length ball on off stump through the leg side, but finds midwicket
Hazlewood to Broom, no run shortish and outside off, chops it down by his feet. The late cut goes awry there
Hazlewood to Broom, no run covers the line of a shortish delivery on middle and off and clips it to midwicket
Hazlewood to Broom, no run full on off stump, pushes it to mid-on
Faulkner to Neesham, 1 run gets under a short delivery outside off and heaves it to deep midwicket
Faulkner to Broom, no run back of the hand slower ball, just outside off, Broom attempts to glide it to third man again, but is surprised by the kick off the pitch. Nearly gloves it to the keeper
Faulkner to Broom, no run extra bounce as Faulkner comes around the wicket, the slower ball biting into the pitch and leaping up towards the splice of the bat
Faulkner to Broom, no run
Faulkner to Broom, 1 run fuller ball outside off, drives through to the man sweeping on the off side boundary
Faulkner to Neesham, no run flashes outside off, but without proper footwork he has no hope of making connection. Good slower ball from Faulkner again

Hazlewood to Broom, no run digs it in short, Broom goes for a pull and Hazlewood barely even asks for a caught behind appeal, but the umpire Palliyaguruge says sure, why not? The batsman goes for a review straight away though and with nothing on both HotSpot and Snicko, the on-field decision is overruled. Take nothing away from the ball though, climbed up towards Broom's left shoulder, cramping him up and preventing him from making good, or any, connection
Hazlewood to Broom, 1 run shortish and outside off, dabs it to deep third man
Hazlewood to Neesham, no run shortish and outside off, cuts to point

Hazlewood to Neesham, FOUR runs nails the pull, hit so far in front of square that it should deflate a fast bowler. Hazlewood tries to go short again, but this time it didn't quite rise up high enough. Neesham takes it from outside off and swings it past midwicket
Hazlewood to Neesham, FOUR runs flat-batted over mid-on! Gets the length to go up and over with a straight bat and he doesn't waste it
Hazlewood to Neesham, 1 run works it into the leg side, behind square
Faulkner to Neesham, 2 runs full and down leg - it's the off-pace delivery again - Neesham rolls his wrists and sends it to deep square leg
Faulkner to Neesham, no run pats a back of a length delivery outside off to cover
Faulkner to Neesham, no run invites the drive and gets it as Neesham finds cover again
Faulkner to Neesham, 1 run carves it between point and cover, standing up tall against a short and wide delivery. Brings up New Zealand's 200
Faulkner to Broom, 1 run gets up on his toes and flicks a short delivery off his hip towards short fine leg

Faulkner to Neesham, no run rather a bit full to be attempting a cut shot, and again Neesham is beaten. Faulkner's seen this almost every over since coming back to bowl in his second spell and he has his hands on his hips, not amused at his luck
Hazlewood to Broom, no run attempts to clip a shortish delivery into the leg side, but takes it high on the pad instead

Hazlewood to Broom, SIX runs rushes down the track and hammers it onto the sightscreen. Takes till the 38th over for the first six on a ground where the straight boundary is about 60 m. Top shot from Broom though, changing a length ball into an overpitched one with his footwork. Actually damages the sightscreen electronics
Hazlewood to Broom, 1 run opens the face and runs a short of a length delivery past backward point
Hazlewood to Neesham, 2 runs stays deep in his crease to hatchet a short delivery on middle and up and over the leg side infield to long-on
Hazlewood to Neesham, no run length ball outside off, defends to point

Hazlewood to Neesham, OUT top edge as he pulls and deep midwicket takes a simple catch. Excellent time for a wicket and it comes from their Mr Dependable. Simple, back of a length, not much room to free the arms. Neesham tries to make a bit too much of it and mistimes his shot. Head steadies himself a few yards inside the fence and takes it well
Starc to Broom, no run full on middle and leg, turns it to midwicket
Starc to Broom, 1 run guides it to sweeper cover
Starc to Santner, no run steps forward to a fuller delivery outside off and the bat face turns in his hands as the ball thuds into it. Mid-on mops up
Starc to Santner, no run tucks a full delivery on leg stump to midwicket
Starc to Santner, no run comes forward and defends a fuller ball outside off with the inside edge
Starc to Santner, no run changes the pace, and this 124 kph delivery, is aimed at the base of off stump. Santner keeps it out
Hazlewood to Broom, 1 wide digs it in, but lines it down the leg side. Broom goes for a pull but he fails to make any connection
Hazlewood to Broom, 1 run on the pads and Broom, trying to deflect it off his hip, gets an inside edge and finds a single at square leg
Hazlewood to Santner, no run fuller delivery on off stump, defends off the open face
Hazlewood to Santner, no run good length ball on middle, Santner covers it
Hazlewood to Santner, 1 run a little room to work with and Santner punches the length ball through the covers
Hazlewood to Broom, 1 run swivels on his back foot as he takes a bouncer on and pulls it to long leg
Hazlewood to Santner, no run back of a length on middle and leg, keeps it out
Starc to Broom, FOUR runs gets his fifty with a phenomenal extra cover drive. It's length. He sees he can get under it. And he pummels it over the top. Eden Park roars
Starc to Broom, no run slings down a yorker at 146 kph, from wide of the crease, and Broom digs it out to point

Starc to Broom, no run another yorker, angled sharply into the leg stump. Broom falls over as he tries to flick and is hit on the pads. Shouldn't be out lbw, the umpire doesn't give it, but Australia review. There's no bat, and on impact, middle and off stump are visible, an indication that it would miss the leg. HawkEye confirms

Starc to Broom, SIX runs has he taken it? Hazlewood leaps in the air, right on the edge of the boundary at third man, and comes up with a one-hander. So cool. So calm. Tracking it all the way. Such a super effort. But is his foot on the line? He isn't entirely happy with the effort, so that's an indicator that he felt the advertising skirting on his boot. The short boundaries at Eden Park comes to Broom's rescue and his upper cut to a short ball wide outside off comes
Starc to Broom, 1 wide spears a 145 kph delivery down the leg side, Broom tries to get his bat on it with a flick but he has no chance
Starc to Broom, no run full on off stump, defends
Starc to Broom, 1 run full and outside off, drives through point
Cummins to Broom, 1 run shortish and just outside off, Broom guides it past the wicketkeeper's right

Cummins to Santner, OUT what a shot, but oh, there's a fielder there, it's Maxwell, and its a stunning catch! Flashes a little grin after running several yards to his right, eyes always on the ball, taking it cleanly as he bends low and then gets into a military-style roll with the momentum he had going. Top effort. And one of the few times Santner times the ball, and he did so well to back away to make his own room against a good short ball
Cummins to Broom, 1 run guides a shortish delivery to deep third man

Cummins to Southee, 4 byes oopsy, the stand-in keeper mucks up. It's the slower ball outside off, Broom tries the dab to third man, but comes up with nothing. The ball bounces before it reaches Handscomb and spins away to his left
Cummins to Southee, OUT backs away and goes for the upper cut and he hasn't got enough on it. Third man comes up off the boundary, steadies himself and takes a good catch. Faulkner the man there
Cummins to Broom, 1 run and he does so, dabbing a back of a length delivery to deep third man
Starc to Broom, no run starts around the wicket and beats Broom, who is trying to late cut a back of a length slower ball which cramps him for room
Starc to Broom, 2 runs guides it behind point for a couple of runs
Starc to Broom, 1 run looks for the yorker, but ends up with a low full toss. Broom lets it run off to deep midwicket
Starc to Santner, no run full on off stump, Santner blocks the 143 kph delivery to midwicket
Starc to Santner, no run length ball, on the pads, and Santner, who is pushing deep in his crease, finds midwicket again
Starc to Santner, 1 run gets an inside edge as he tries to push a fuller delivery to mid-off and instead steals a single to long leg
Hazlewood to Santner, 1 run fuller delivery outside off, pushes it to mid-off and pinches a single
Hazlewood to Broom, 1 run pulls, but can only get a single for it because Hazlewood hasn't given any room for Broom to work with
Hazlewood to Santner, no run swats a bouncer, coming up past his chest, to short midwicket
Hazlewood to Santner, 1 run belts a full delivery just outside off to a deepish mid-off
Hazlewood to Broom, 1 run lets the short ball come onto him and deflects it behind square leg

Hazlewood to Santner, no run pushes him back with one coming up to his chest, on leg stump, so the only option for Santner is to bunt it down the pitch. Intelligent cricket from Hazlewood, forcing the batsman into awkward positions when all he is thinking about is hitting the ball hard
Starc to Broom, 1 wide full and quite a distance outside off, Broom can collect the extra
Starc to Broom, FOUR runs lashes it over extra cover. He's playing a gem of an innings, but at this point it is unsure whether it will be enough. Gets length, thrashes length
Starc to Broom, no run digs out a yorker to point
Starc to Broom, no run beaten for pace as a 145 kph delivery, a wide yorker, skips past the flashing blade

Starc to Broom, 1 leg bye slings a full delivery into the pads and Broom is struck on the toe at full pace, he's floored too, but has enough of his faculties to take a leg bye. Outstanding yorker bowler, this fellow, and this angle from around the wicket, wide of the crease, with that slingy arm action makes it all the more difficult
Starc to Ferguson, no run 145 kph, full and straight at the stumps, Ferguson manages to keep it out
Starc to Ferguson, no run low full toss, pushes it to deep point. Broom says no on the single to keep the strike

Cummins to Broom, no run good bowling. that's the slower ball, dug into the middle of the deck, biting into it and cutting into the right-hander. Broom goes for a cut, lets out a loud grunt too by evidence of the stump mics, and is beaten
Cummins to Broom, SIX runs too straight, too easy to be picked up. Broom clears his front leg and heaves it over the long leg boundary, well to the left of the man in the deep
Cummins to Broom, 1 run reaches out in front of him, over his shoulder, to drag a short ball from outside off to deep midwicket

Cummins to Ferguson, no run bouncer, aims it at Ferguson's left ear, avoids it. The square leg umpire Wayne Knights originally intended to signal wide, but then changed his mind. Good bowling, although Eden Park boos at the lack of a wide
Cummins to Ferguson, 1 run shortish and outside off, slashed behind point
Cummins to Broom, 1 run backs away and cuts a short delivery on off stump to deep point. Keep the strike with two overs to go
Starc to Broom, 1 run carves a full and wide delivery to deep point

Starc to Santner, 1 run good length on off stump, Santner taps and runs to cover. Excellent single, and Broom showing the requisite desperation with a big dive to beat a direct hit from jersey number 9. Possibly Heazlett?
Starc to Broom, 1 run spins on his back foot to pull a short ball from outside off to deep midwicket
Starc to Santner, 1 run backs away from a full delivery on leg stump and drills it to long-on
Starc to Broom, FOUR runs that's well played. He picks the slower ball, at 124 kph, and gives it a good thrashing. Strong hands, which slice the ball over backward point
Starc to Broom, no run full and just outside off, as Starc moves around the wicket to cut the angle, Broom steers it to point
Hazlewood to Santner, 1 run moves leg side, he is preempting the short-ball tactic from Hazlewood, and punches the ball through cover

Hazlewood to Broom, no run that's a ripper. At 136 kph, it hits the deck just outside off and surprises a set batsman with extra bounce. Broom is thinking about a glide to third man, but the ball soars over his gloves
Hazlewood to Broom, no run another shortish delivery outside off and Broom, while trying to tap it to third man, refuses to go through with the shot. Worried about losing his wicket here
Hazlewood to Broom, no run covers the line of a back of a length delivery on off stump and blocks. Cross-seamer that
Hazlewood to Broom, no run that's another cross-seamer, pitched up, asking the drive. Broom goes for it, walking into the shot, aiming at the covers. He is beaten
Hazlewood to Broom, 1 run gets down low with a full delivery outside off and runs it to third man. That's the end of Hazlewood, with six overs to go.
Faulkner to Broom, no run that's the back of the hand slower ball, from over the wicket, Broom wanders outside off to try and scoop it to the long leg boundary but misses it completely
Faulkner to Broom, 1 run another slower ball, this one full and outside off, drills it to cover
Faulkner to Ferguson, 1 run 106kph, change of pace, at a full length and outside off, Ferguson skews it to short third man

Faulkner to Broom, OUT comes down the track and hoists a back of the hand slower ball on leg stump to long-on. End of a fine innings from Broom, who has basically had to fight all on his lonesome all through the middle overs
Faulkner to Boult, no run pokes at a slower ball but fails to make contact
Faulkner to Boult, 1 run full toss outside off, slaps it to long-on

Cummins to Boult, SIX runs these two were there two years ago, but it was Williamson who hit Cummins for six to win the game. Here Boult gets his piece, backing away and carving the bouncer over the third man boundary
Cummins to Boult, 1 run off the splice to mid-off, as the short ball angled into the body is met with a full-on swipe. Looking to square leg, but beaten soundly for pace
Cummins to Ferguson, 1 run dabs a shortish delivery into the covers

Cummins to Boult, FOUR runs hammers it over straight midwicket. Right off the middle, and his tactic to run away to the leg side and make his own room while Cummins is trying to cramp him works superbly
Cummins to Boult, no run lands a yorker, which meanders down the leg side. The umpire gives the bowler a little bit of leeway with Boult having made a move back and well outside off

Cummins to Boult, FOUR runs finishes the innings in style, the back foot is camped deep in the crease, the front foot is nowhere to be found as Boult belts a length delivery outside off to the long-off boundary. Timely cameo from the No. 11

Australia wouldn't entirely be fazed by this target, they've got power-hitters aplenty, but with a couple of new faces in their middle order and their captain for the tour Matthew Wade out injured, you just can't be sure. Not much should sour the mood of Marcus Stoinis though, he picked up Kane Williamson as his first ODI wicket, followed it up by removing Martin Guptill for 61 and eventually finished with 10-0-49-3. Join us in about half an hour for the resumption.

2.48 pm New Zealand did not look like they would be getting 286 when they were 134 for 5. But Neil Broom, in his second coming as an international cricketer, played another outstanding innings. His third ODI fifty was well paced, and notable in perhaps the shots he chose not to play as much as those he did. It was on his 73 that New Zealand have built this total on.
3.15 pm The huddle's been dispensed with. Eden Park welcomes their team with warm applause, and into it stride Australia's openers, Travis Head and his captain for the day Aaron Finch
Southee runs in with the new ball from over the wicket
Southee to Finch, no run short of a length and angled in, jumps off the ground and plays back to the bowler
Southee to Finch, no run back of a length and outside off, punched to cover
Southee to Finch, no run good length and swings away outside off, patted to backward point
Southee to Finch, 1 run full inswinger, which is worked away to midwicket. Australia and Finch are off the mark
Southee to Head, no run short of a length and skids on outside off, jabbed out to point
Southee to Head, no run good length on middle, Head gets behind the line and defends to the off side

Boult to Finch, 2 runs back of a length, angling away wide outside off, Finch has to reach out for the ball. Slashed over cover-point. Finch clutches his left hamstring right after making contact with the ball
Boult to Finch, 1 run leg-stump ball, deflected to long leg
Boult to Head, no run very full and angled in on middle and leg, squeezed out to midwicket
Boult to Head, no run full, around off, hint of outswing, pushed to point
Boult to Head, no run just short of a good length and outside off, throws his bat at ball and chops behind to the keeper
Boult to Head, 1 run full outswinger outside off, reaches out for the ball with his hands, slicing a drive to Broom at backward point
Southee to Head, no run back of a length and slanting away outside off, Head reaches out for another ambitious cut. Under-edges it behind to the keeper
Southee to Head, FOUR runs fractionally short and outside off, Head skips back, picks it up and pulls emphatically over midwicket
Southee to Head, no run not as short as the previous ball, chopped from outside off to backward point
Southee to Head, no run pitched up and outside off, Head responds with a front-foot drive straight of mid-off
Southee to Head, no run good length and angling away outside off, Head drops it to the off side, adjacent to his feet
Southee to Head, no run Head, who is standing on leg stump, shuffles across and crunches a drive, but can't beat the well-populated off-side field
Boult to Marsh, 1 run nudged to the left of Santner at short midwicket. Marsh sets off for a single. A direct hit from Santner could have had Head
Boult to Head, no run very full and slanted in on off, played back to the bowler
Boult to Head, no run back of a length and outside off, forced to cover
Boult to Marsh, no run the length is short for the cut but this is too close to the body. Chopped behind past the off stump
Southee to Handscomb, 1 run very full on middle and leg, hangs back and clips to midwicket
Southee to Marsh, no run very full, hint of inswing, flicked to mid-on
Southee to Marsh, no run good length and slanting away outside off, dabbed to cover
Southee to Marsh, 1 run full and angling away outside off, opens the face and dinks the ball wide enough of wide slip. Played down to third man
Southee to Handscomb, no run full and straight on middle, blocked with a straight bat to mid-off
Southee to Handscomb, 1 run short of a length and outside off, Handscomb is happy to camp back and run it down to third man
Boult to Handscomb, FOUR runs back of a length and width outside off, Handscomb jumps onto the width and punches it in the gap at cover
Boult to Handscomb, no run full and angled into a defence to the off side
Boult to Handscomb, 1 run short of a length and angled outside off, Handscomb plays at the last possible moment and glides it down to third man
Boult to Marsh, no run full and holds its line outside off, Marsh watches it through to the keeper
Boult to Marsh, no run full and floated on middle, Marsh ventures forward and across to negotiate it
Boult to Marsh, no run back of a length and kicks away outside off, beats the attempted cut

Southee to Handscomb, OUT there's a clicking sound as the stand-in keeper Latham gloves the ball. Umpire Knight shakes his head. NZ challenge the on-field not-out decision. Cross-seamer from Southee. Handsomb simply prods at it away from the body, and nicks it behind. Hotspot detects a white blotch and nicko detects a spike as the ball passes the bat. Handscomb has to go. Umpire Knight reverses his call, raises his finger, and sends back Handscomb
Southee to Maxwell, FOUR runs Maxwell is greeted by a short ball, angled in on off, pulls and gets enough bat on it to send the ball away fine on the leg side past the diving keeper
Southee to Maxwell, no run
Southee to Maxwell, 1 run full and outside off, guided through backward point
Southee to Marsh, FOUR runs nice and full outside off - not a half-volley, Marsh flows forward and drives it smoothly straight of mid-off
Southee to Marsh, no run Southee drags his length back outside off, Marsh punches into the covers
Boult to Maxwell, no run back of a length and slanting away outside off, opens the face and dabs to backward point
Boult to Maxwell, no run back of a length on leg stump, whipped to midwicket on the back foot
Boult to Maxwell, no run tight line and length, no room at all, defended back to the bowler
Boult to Maxwell, 1 run picked away off the hips to long leg
Boult to Marsh, FOUR runs short on middle and leg, and with fine leg up, Marsh gets inside the line and helps it away fine of short fine leg
Boult to Marsh, FOUR runs short and skids off the deck outside off, Marsh is opened up as he sends an outside edge flying in the air... Taylor leaps but can only tip it over
Southee to Maxwell, no run
Southee to Maxwell, no run short and wide outside off, flayed away to backward point, sprawling save from Munro
Southee to Maxwell, 1 run good length, Southee brings out the offbreak variation, Marsh waits on the ball and defends to the off side
Southee to Marsh, no run full on off, pushed back on the front foot
Southee to Marsh, no run
Southee to Marsh, no run short of a length and outside off, leans back and cuts to point
Boult to Maxwell, 2 runs full and sliding into the leg stump, clipped away square through the leg side to the right of long leg
Boult to Maxwell, no run De Grandhomme, subbing for Broom, throws himself to his right from backward point and stops this full-blooded cut
Boult to Maxwell, no run back of a length on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
Boult to Maxwell, FOUR runs shot. Full on off, Maxwell punches on the front foot, through the legs of the non-striker, and skips away straight of mid-on
Boult to Maxwell, no run back of a length and angled in on off, defended
Boult to Maxwell, 2 runs full on the pads from over the wicket, knocked in the direction of midwicket
Ferguson to Marsh, no run short and wide outside off, thrashes a cut to the right of extra cover, tumbling save
Ferguson to Marsh, no run short and hurries on outside off, fended to leg
Ferguson to Marsh, 1 run short and wide outside off, forced to deep point on the back foot
Ferguson to Maxwell, 1 run very full and slanted in, chipped to mid-on
Ferguson to Marsh, 1 run short of a length and angling away outside off, punched past backward point, but deep third man hunts it down
Ferguson to Maxwell, no run ripping bouncer outside off, throat-high delivery, 149ks - pace like fire - Maxwell drops his wrists and rocks out of the way
Santner to Marsh, no run short and sliding across off, pushed back, Santner dives to his left and stops it
Santner to Heazlett, no run flat and angled across off from around the wicket, punched back to Santner
Santner to Heazlett, 1 run drifting into the leg stump, tucked to deep midwicket
Santner to Maxwell, no run more round-arm than usual, clatters into the front pad of Maxwell, heading down
Santner to Maxwell, no run tossed outside off, pushed to cover on the front foot
Ferguson to Heazlett, no run bouncer outside off, upper-cuts and misses
Ferguson to Heazlett, 1 run dragged short and outside off, shovelled to deep midwicket
Ferguson to Maxwell, FOUR runs short and angled in on the hips, helped away fine on the leg side. Sensible stuff
Ferguson to Maxwell, no run short of a length on middle, 150ks, punched to mid-on
Ferguson to Maxwell, no run nasty short ball, hits the deck, rears up and Maxwell somehow fends on the pitch
Santner to Heazlett, 1 run flatter on middle and leg, glanced to long leg
Santner to Stoinis, no run looped up outside off, pushed to the left of the bowler
Santner to Stoinis, no run round-armed into the pads, nudged to the leg side
Santner to Stoinis, no run fast slider, defended with a straight bat
Santner to Stoinis, no run drifts in on off, drops at the batsman, chipped to the left of the bowler
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run tossed up on leg stump, knocked down to long-on
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run short and angled on leg or just outside leg, hunkers down
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run back of a length and angled in on off, played back to the bowler
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run back of a length, kicks and screams at Stoinis. He fends it down
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run full and slung into the pads, diverted square on the leg side
Ferguson to Stoinis, 1 run short and wide outside off, slashes a cut down to third man
Ferguson to Heazlett, no run short and outside off, Ferguson is too quick for the debutant. Attempts a pull and watches the ball dribble back to the bowler
Santner to Stoinis, no run nudged off the pads to short fine leg
Santner to Stoinis, no run shortish and angled in on off, back-foot punch back to Santner
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run sliding into the hips, directed to short fine leg
Santner to Heazlett, no run
Santner to Heazlett, no run flighted nicely on middle, this full ball is driven back to the bowler
Santner to Heazlett, no run short and just outside off, short-armed away to midwicket
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run short and angled in, raps the glove as the ball lobs to the off side
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run short and just below the chest, hops and fends to midwicket
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run back of a length on off, punched back to the bowler
Ferguson to Stoinis, 2 runs short and slung into the pads, tucked around the corner
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run good length and angled in on off, Stoinis does well to come forward, meet the pitch, and defend it back to the bowler
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run short and fizzes on outside off, Stoinis is beaten for pace. The ball grazes the inside edge and streaks away to leg-gully
Santner to Heazlett, 1 run pushes it through from over the wicket into the pads, Heazlett picks it away to long leg
Santner to Stoinis, no run goes back to a flatter delivery on off stump and keeps it out

Santner to Stoinis, FOUR runs spots the short ball so early and then powers it away over straight midwicket. Solid base on the back foot, reads the lack of turn, knows he can hit into the leg side as he pleases
Santner to Stoinis, no run good length ball on off stump - much better line for the rapid pace he's bowling - defends
Santner to Stoinis, no run that's a lot slower, brings Stoinis forward with a block in front of off stump
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run drives fluently through to long-off to retain strike
Ferguson to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length and just outside off, Stoinis stands tall and punches into the covers
Ferguson to Faulkner, no run lands a yorker on middle, digs it out
Ferguson to Faulkner, no run length ball on off stump, handled
Ferguson to Faulkner, no run sends down a bouncer, at 138 kph, on and around off stump. Faulkner tucks his head into his armpit to avoid it
Ferguson to Faulkner, 1 run full on leg stump, deflected past leg gully to get off the mark
Santner to Faulkner, no run shimmies down the track and pushes it down the ground, Santner dives to his left and stops the runs
Santner to Faulkner, no run good work from the man at midwicket, diving to his right to stop a well-timed short-armed jab from leading to runs
Santner to Faulkner, no run fires it in on middle, Faulkner trying to flick it with a closed face, gets a leading edge
Santner to Faulkner, no run
Santner to Faulkner, no run fires it in on middle, defends
Santner to Faulkner, no run a little slower through the air, a little shorter in length, Faulkner is unsure what to do with it as he belatedly tries to dab into the leg side
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run 143kph, moves in line with a length ball outside off and guides it to backward point
Ferguson to Stoinis, 1 run 146kph, goes short and at the body, Stoinis does well to move across and flick it off his hips to long leg
Ferguson to Faulkner, no run gets up on his toes to a short delivery at 144 kph and blunts it towards point
Ferguson to Faulkner, no run fuller ball outside off, steps forward to defend
Ferguson to Faulkner, 1 run works his wrists over a shortish delivery on off stump and sends it to midwicket

Ferguson to Stoinis, no run lovely batting. Stoinis looks absolutely unhurried today. Rising up with the short ball outside off and guiding it to point. He's been Australia's player of the day, can he pull off this miracle?
Santner to Faulkner, 1 run keeps back and flicks a length delivery angled into leg stump to long leg
Santner to Stoinis, no run good length ball - at slower pace - on middle stump. Stoinis is forward with a block
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run strides down the pitch at the first sign of flight and hammers a ball from outside off down to long-on
Santner to Faulkner, 1 run waits on a flatter delivery on leg stump and clips it to midwicket
Santner to Stoinis, no run goes back to block on off stump
Santner to Stoinis, no run comes down the track for a length ball on off stump - Santner flattened his length seeing the batsman's tactics - pushes it to midwicket
Ferguson to Faulkner, no run 139kph, full on off stump, blocks it
Ferguson to Faulkner, 1 leg bye on the pads, hits the pads and gives Tom Latham a bit of work to do. He runs to his left and parries the ball to leg gully
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run stands up tall against a back of a length delivery outside off and drills it to cover
Ferguson to Stoinis, no run goes for a bouncer, and it gains considerable height. Umpire calls it one for the over as it flies past Stoinis' left shoulder

Ferguson to Stoinis, 1 run goes for the drive the moment he sees a ball full and outside off, gets a thick edge which flies down to deep third man. Good work from Munro, keeping that to one, sprinting to his right
Ferguson to Faulkner, 1 run full and down leg, picks it to long leg. Might be it for Ferguson
Neesham to Faulkner, 1 run starts with a back of a length delivery on middle, Faulker is up off his toes to tuck the ball into midwicket
Neesham to Stoinis, 1 run moves outside off to take a short delivery on leg stump and pull it to long leg

Neesham to Faulkner, 1 run pats a length delivery to mid-off, seems a little odd that he played that off the back foot, possibly why he mistimes it. Perhaps realised his mistake late because at the last minute he was trying to play with a straight bat rather than the horizontal one for a late cut
Neesham to Stoinis, FOUR runs top edges over the wicketkeeper. Extra bounce from Neesham troubles Stoinis, who commits to a pull despite not having the room to free his arms
Neesham to Stoinis, no run shortish and outside off, slices it to point
Neesham to Stoinis, 1 wide digs it in short over middle and off stump - gains a little too much height for the umpire's liking as Stoinis leaves

Neesham to Stoinis, FOUR runs pure power. He picks the slower delivery - so that shows how composed he is at the crease - and then he maximises on the poor ball - short and outside off - by placing it to the right of long-on
Boult to Faulkner, 1 run back of a length and outside off, pushes it to cover
Boult to Stoinis, 1 run thumps a backfoot drive past short cover's right and gets a single. A bit of early evidence that Stoinis can bat up the order if needed
Boult to Faulkner, 1 run deceives him with a slower ball, slanted full and outside off. Faulkner flicks it, looking ungainly, to mdiwicket
Boult to Stoinis, 2 runs stands tall and pulls a short ball from outside off through straight midwicket.
Boult to Stoinis, 1 run another pull, well controlled as he swivels on his back foot and places it to deep square leg

Boult to Faulkner, no run that's bowling to his field. With plenty of people waiting on the off side, Boult pitches it up and his angle from over the wicket does the rest. Faulkner, caught in the crease, pushes with his hands and is beaten
Neesham to Stoinis, no run full and outside off, he drills it to mid-off
Neesham to Stoinis, 1 run good length ball on middle, defends
Neesham to Faulkner, no run looks for the blockhole on off stump, Stoinis, while trying to flick it away, ends up only pushing it back down the pitch
Neesham to Faulkner, 1 run onto the pads, worked away to long leg
Neesham to Stoinis, no run shortish and outside off, cut behind point
Neesham to Stoinis, no run waits a touch too long that time, trying to pick the gap behind point and ends up being beaten. Threw his head back at the lack of execution
Boult to Faulkner, no run back of a length on off stump, blocks it
Boult to Faulkner, no run full and outside off, lashes it to cover
Boult to Faulkner, no run goes for a bouncer at 139 kph, Faulkner gets below it comfortably
Boult to Faulkner, no run looks for the yorker on off stump, flicks it to mid-on
Boult to Faulkner, 1 run lets the short ball come to him and then dabs it on top of the bounce to deep third man
Boult to Stoinis, no run fuller delivery angled across the right-hander, who leaves it well alone
Neesham to Faulkner, 1 run on the pads, clips it to long leg
Neesham to Stoinis, no run good length on off stump, blocks it down the pitch
Neesham to Stoinis, no run 134 kph, back of a length and outside off, Stoinis punches it into the covers
Neesham to Stoinis, 1 run flicks through midwicket
Neesham to Faulkner, 1 wide finally Australia have their hundred, as Neesham spills a length ball down leg

Neesham to Faulkner, no run comes down the track, that big backlift going high, but Neesham follows Faulkner, cramping him for room and getting the ball to come up towards his stomach. Can only slice to point

Neesham to Faulkner, 2 runs jumps back in his crease to nudge a shortish delivery behind square leg, and since he plays with soft hands, and placed it well to the right of Southee, there's always two on offer
Southee to Stoinis, no run back of a length and outside off, Stoinis gets in line with a straight bat
Southee to Stoinis, no run just a little shape away on this 124 kph good length delivery outside off, and Stoinis who stands and drives on the up is comfortably beaten
Southee to Stoinis, no run goes wide of the crease to try and straighten the ball, but there's not as much on offer this time. Stoinis is back and across with a handsome push to cover
Southee to Stoinis, 2 runs takes a short ball from outside off and pulls through midwicket
Southee to Stoinis, 1 run shortish and outside off, carves it past point to deep third man
Southee to Faulkner, no run fuller delivery on off stump, defends
Neesham to Stoinis, no run short of a length and cramps the batsman for room. Punched to mid-on
Neesham to Stoinis, FOUR runs slightly short and outside off, Stoinis sits deep in the crease and clouts it over midwicket
Neesham to Stoinis, no run full and wide outside off, just inside the tramline, as the batsman swishes and does not connect
Neesham to Stoinis, 1 run length ball on off, firmly struck down the ground
Neesham to Faulkner, no run backs away, the bowler follows him, mis-hits a drive to mid-off
Neesham to Faulkner, FOUR runs Stoinis shuffles down the track and makes room. Ferguson digs it in short, but he still slots a cut wide enough of point and fetches a boundary
Southee to Stoinis, no run length and outside off, punched to cover on the front foot
Southee to Stoinis, FOUR runs very full, overpitched outside off, Stoinis drills it through mid-off. Stoinis is giving a good account of himself in his second ODI
Southee to Stoinis, 1 run
Southee to Faulkner, 2 runs short of a length on middle, goes back and fends it to cover
Southee to Faulkner, no run
Southee to Faulkner, no run
Santner to Stoinis, SIX runs tossed up on off stump, slugged flat and hard over long-on, evades a diving Munro and hits the hoarding on the full
Santner to Stoinis, SIX runs dug short and outside off, Stoinis sizes it up and nails a pull over midwicket. Follows his three-for with a fifty
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run
Santner to Faulkner, no run back of a length, flicked towards the midwicket region
Santner to Faulkner, 1 run darted flat on the pads, hangs back and turns the ball to the right of midwicket
Santner to Stoinis, no run slightly short and wide outside off, chopped away to cover
Munro to Faulkner, no run floated full on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
Munro to Faulkner, 1 wide 112.1ks, rolled down the leg side, past the glance, difficult take for Latham to his left
Munro to Faulkner, 1 run crunched to deep backward point for one
Munro to Stoinis, no run
Munro to Stoinis, 1 run full and straight, clipped away square on the leg side
Munro to Faulkner, 1 wide another leg-side wide
Munro to Faulkner, 1 run full and straight, whipped away to long-on
Munro to Stoinis, 1 run little roller on the pads, tickled away square of short fine leg
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run spears it into the blockhole on off stump, he drills it back to long-off
Santner to Faulkner, no run spears it into the blockhole on off stump, he drills it back to long-off
Santner to Faulkner, no run shortish and outside off, but with the pace being a lot slower, Faulkner's attempt to force the pace with a cut doesn't work. Finds cover
Santner to Faulkner, 1 wide looks for the arm ball, but it strays well wide of off stump
Santner to Faulkner, 1 run pushes it through cover
Santner to Stoinis, no run looks to take a length ball from well wide of off stump and sweep it away. Ends up mistiming to square leg, looks to snitch a single but is rightly sent back
Munro to Faulkner, 1 run shortish and outside off, Faulkner whips it to long-on from deep in his crease
Munro to Stoinis, 1 run falls short of Ferguson at short third man. Stoinis was trying to slice a boundary to third man, but the change in pace does him

Munro to Cummins, no run beats him first ball as a good length ball outside off invites the drive. Cummins goes for it, looking for cover but comes up with nothing. Good take from Latham standing up behind the stumps
Munro to Cummins, no run now Latham's gone back and watches a good length ball outside off being driven to cover
Munro to Cummins, 1 run back of a length and outside off, taps it through extra cover
Ferguson to Cummins, no run 133kph, defends a back of a length delivery outside off off the bottom of the bat
Ferguson to Cummins, 2 runs mistimes a pull, looks a bit like he was into the shot a tad too early and was trying to adjust. Lucky the ball lands well in front of deep midiwcket
Ferguson to Cummins, no run full on off stump, defends
Ferguson to Cummins, no run good length ball, skirting by beside off stump, with the slip and wicketkeeper watching its progress. Cummins shoulders arms
Ferguson to Cummins, no run full and outside off, Cummins opens the face but finds point

Ferguson to Cummins, FOUR runs past first slip, Taylor diving to his right, stretching out a hand cannot get there. Can't really be called a drop. Good bowling from Ferguson though, hitting a good length and inviting the unchecked drive.
Munro to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length and outside off, Stoinis punches a single to cover
Munro to Cummins, FOUR runs dragged down outside off, Cummins punishes Munro, pulling hard over midwicket
Munro to Cummins, 1 run much better from Munro. Full and just a shade outside off, pushed down to long-on
Munro to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length on middle, manufactures room by backing away and stabs it with a flat bat down to long-off
Munro to Cummins, FOUR runs full, barely 103ks, on off, chipped in the air and just clears Williamson at mid-off. Delectable shot
Munro to Cummins, no run slightly short and outside off, chopped to short third man
Ferguson to Stoinis, 1 run mighty full on off, swiped across the line to wide mid-on
Ferguson to Cummins, no run back of a length and thuds into the splice of the bat. Fended back to the bowler
Ferguson to Cummins, no run full and outside off, drives through the line to extra cover
Ferguson to Cummins, 1 run short of a length and outside off, smartly late cut away to the right of deep third man

Ferguson to Stoinis, FOUR runs and it fetches him s a boundary right away with some help from Southee who fumbles sliding at mid-on and going for the ball with only one hand. Slower short ball outside off, swatted to the long-on fence
Ferguson to Stoinis, 1 run
Southee to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length and outside off, punched to mid-off
Southee to Cummins, no run chopped from off stump to point
Southee to Cummins, no run back of a length on middle, chipped to the right of Guptill at short midwicket

Southee to Cummins, FOUR runs length ball outside off, pinged over the covers. Williamson slides at the edge of the boundary and knocks it back in. Or is he in contact with the ball while brushing the hoarding? Yes, it seems like, it's a four
Southee to Cummins, no run
Southee to Cummins, 1 run back of a length and outside off, flat-batted to mid-off who is inside the circle
Ferguson to Cummins, FOUR runs short ball, slung in on off, rushes the batsman into a pull. Top-edged in the air between keeper and slip
Ferguson to Cummins, 2 runs length ball outside off, flat-batted away to the left of mid-on. Southee dives to his left and takes some pace off the ball
Ferguson to Cummins, SIX runs back of a length on off, ripe for a launch right now. Back of the hand slower ball, dispatched disdainfully over midwicket
Ferguson to Cummins, no run rapid short ball, skids into strike the thigh. Beaten for pace

Ferguson to Cummins, 1 run Guptill flies to his right from extra cover, stretches his right hand out, nearly pulls off a one-hander. The ball hits the wrist and goes down. Saves a boundary. Cummins sliced a drive in the air
Ferguson to Stoinis, 1 run shortish and outside off, flayed to point, tumbling save
Santner to Stoinis, no run turn and bounce, beats the slash
Santner to Stoinis, no run tossed up, down the track and drilled back
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run reverse-paddled from the stumps to short third man
Santner to Cummins, 1 run looped up on off stump, slogged across the line to deep midwicket
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run skips out, converts it into a full-toss and belts it to long-off
Neesham to Stoinis, 1 wide leg-side wide
Neesham to Stoinis, SIX runs length ball outside off, Stoinis backs away outside leg and clobbers it over cover. Picked the offcutter and hit the pants off it
Neesham to Stoinis, 1 wide slower bouncer, too high. Wide called
Neesham to Stoinis, SIX runs too full on off, Stoinis gets under it and hoists it over long-on. Clean strike
Neesham to Stoinis, no run lifter on middle, the batsman sways his upper body out of the way
Neesham to Stoinis, SIX runs back of a length on off, Stoinis moves into the 90s with a lusty club over the bowler's head. Williamson's anxiety grows
Neesham to Stoinis, no run low full-toss on off, slapped flat and hard to long-off. Williamson drops it. Stinging blow. He dives to his right but the ball pops out
Neesham to Stoinis, 1 run low full-toss, hacked to long-on. 21 off that over
Santner to Stoinis, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, waits on it and cracks a cut through backward point
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run
Santner to Starc, 2 runs yorker on middle, outside-edged down to third man
Santner to Starc, 1 run flat and sliding across off, square-cut away
Santner to Stoinis, 1 run full and angled in on off, defended
Boult to Stoinis, no run full and straying into the pads, clipped away to square leg
Boult to Stoinis, no run shimmies down the track, meets a short ball, and swats to long-on. Declines the single
Boult to Stoinis, 5 wide bouncer, sails over the batsman, sails over the keeper. Five wides

Boult to Stoinis, SIX runs Boult serves up a length ball on middle, Stoinis dispatches it over long-on and brings up his maiden century in his second ODI. He is the first Australian to take three wickets and hit a hundred in an ODI
Boult to Stoinis, SIX runs backs away outside leg and carves a full-toss up and over wide mid-off. Goes all the way
Boult to Stoinis, no run full and wide outside off, scythes and misses
Boult to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length on off, camps back, jabs to cover for one
Southee to Stoinis, no run short on leg, following the batsman, chopped to short third man
Southee to Stoinis, SIX runs slower offcutter, clears the biggest boundary at Eden Park with a muscular tug. Slammed over midwicket
Southee to Stoinis, FOUR runs dug short and outside off, Stoinis sits back waiting for it and carves over short third man. This is some innings from Stoinis
Southee to Stoinis, SIX runs full on off stump, Southee misses his length again. Stoinis smites it over the short, straight boundary. He is doing it for Australia on his own. Tense faces in the crowd
Southee to Stoinis, no run low full-toss outside off, flat-batted away to long-off. Stoinis declines the single

Southee to Stoinis, 1 run pandemonium at Eden Park. Full and outside off, front-foot drive to cover from Stoinis. Kane Williamson swoops down on the ball, runs in, then decides to throw the ball to the bowler's end. Santner running in does not gather it cleanly. He can't capitalise on the mix-up between the wickets. Stoinis could have been dismissed, instead he runs across for one and pinches the strike
Boult to Stoinis, 2 runs low full-toss on off, dragged away towards wide long-on. Broom makes a sprawling save, sliding to his right from deep midwicket
Boult to Stoinis, no run back of a length and outside off, sliced away over cover. The ball swirls to the right of third man. He does not take the single. Two on offer. He does not take it either
Boult to Stoinis, no run full and outside off, driven to cover
Boult to Stoinis, no run 140.2ks short ball, fizzes off the surface, cramps the batsman for room and pings the glove, beating the hook
Boult to Stoinis, FOUR runs back of a length and on off stump, 138ks, slogged away to the right of Broom at deep midwicket

Boult to Stoinis, 1 leg bye Has Stoinis nicked it behind? Not given by Palliyaguruge. And they cross over. Latham should have run up and attempted to flick the ball onto the stumps. New Zealand challenge the on-field not out decision. Good-length indipper,cramps the batsman for room. He jams his bat down, the ball grazes the flap of the front pad and carries through to the keeper. Snicko picks up a spike - that's when the ball hit the pad. No clear evidence of an in
Southee to Stoinis, no run low full-toss, hit to deep midwicket, but they don't run

Southee to Stoinis, no run Ripping effort from Broom. He dives full length to his left and meets the ball on a half-volley and knocks it away towards long-off. Wide yorker, dragged away to wide long-on
Southee to Stoinis, no run full and outside off, slapped away to cover
Southee to Stoinis, SIX runs similar ball - full and wide outside off - Stoinis throws his hands at it and slices it over cover. Clears the bigger boundary

Southee to Stoinis, SIX runs low full-toss outside off, smeared over long-off for a six. Fifty partnership with no contribution at all from Hazlewood. He hasn't faced a ball yet. Unbelievable scenes at Eden Park
7pm 27, 911 fans celebrate with Kane Williamson and his team on Auckland day. Stoinis is stranded and left heart-broken.
7.10pm I shall bring you the presentations

7.15pm Stoinis arrived at 54 for 5 and did not budge at all. He picked off the gaps with Faulkner, picked off the short straight boundaries with the tail, and powered onto follow an uninterrupted spell of 10-0-49-3 with a sterling century. He even added a fifty stand with No.11 Josh Hazlewood with the latter not facing a ball in about 30 minutes. During the process, Stoinis became the first Australian to hit a century and claim three wickets in an ODI. At the end of another
New Zealand won by 6 runs
Player of the match is Marcus Stoinis, AUS
